did.unittitle: ILR School Extension Division Metropolitan District Office (New York, N.Y.), Peter Lazes Audio-Visual Materials
did.abstract: This collection consists of nine VHS tapes collected by Peter Lazes in the course of his work.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Peter Lazes was the founder and Director of the Healthcare Transformation Project within Cornell University's School of Industrial and Labor Relations. The Healthcare Transformation Project was established in 1997 to assist union and management healthcare leaders create integrated delivery systems to improve patient care and reduce costs. This program provided labor union and management leaders with customized consulting, research, and educational programs to implement strategic worker participation programs. His work involved assisting hospitals and healthcare organizations to develop methods to improve patient care and reduce costs with a focus on frontline staff engagement.

In addition to his work with the Healthcare Transformation Project, he has served as a consultant for organizations in a variety of sectors and written over 30 articles and produced several videos on topics such as organizational change, innovation and new work systems, new roles for unions, and strategies for keeping American jobs. Dr. Lazes's international activities included consulting and education programs in Ireland, Poland, Norway, and UK. Peter received his Ph.D. in clinical and industrial psychology from Union Institute and University.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: /4354/012: ILR School Extension Division Metropolitan District Office (New York, N.Y.), Peter Lazes Files

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Due to the fragility and potential degradation of moving image and sound recordings, viewing and listening is limited to items that have been digitized. If an item is in another media format, you may request to have the item digitized for access. Information on ordering access copies may be found on the Kheel Center webpage.
